comments:
This is a reproducible problem for me.  Start with newly installed Eclipse 
(/usr/local/eclipse/eclipse -ws gtk).  When importing existing project 'infra', 
click on finish button and see infra added to list of projects.  However, the 
import project dialog does not close and there is error output in the console...

Unhandled exception caught in event loop.
Reason:
Failed to execute runnable (java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException)

*** Stack trace of contained exception ***
Reason:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
Unhandled exception caught in event loop.
Reason:
Failed to execute runnable (java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException)

*** Stack trace of contained exception ***
Reason:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
Unhandled exception caught in event loop.
Reason:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

Next, shutdown Eclipse and restart '/usr/local/home/eclipse/eclipse -ws gtk'.  
The Eclipse splash screen is displayed but the workspace is never displayed.  
In the console, there is error output...

[dgantenb@orcadev002 orca]$ eclipse -ws gtk
log4j:WARN No appenders could be found for logger 
(net.sf.tapestry.util.xml.AbstractDocumentParser).
log4j:WARN Please initialize the log4j system properly.
org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: Widget is disposed
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.error(Widget.java:290)

Have to manually kill the Eclipse process, but from now on can never get 
Eclipse to start for that workspace.
Discussed with DH.  Suggests further assessment by Platform UI .

Please could you check the log file in the .metadata directory? There should 
be a stack of an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException in the log.

There seems to be 3 problems here:
  1) a problem decorating an image.
  2) the decorator is not using save runnable.
  3) The workbench does not restart.

Assiging to Tod to investigate the first two. Please assign it back to me once 
they are fixed. I would like to investigate why the workbench does not 
restart. Please add the steps to reproduce it you can.

The ArrayOutofBounds exception was as a result of Bug 31190 which is fixed in 
the current stream. The problem there is that it was possible to have an array 
of elements that was too large due to a timing issue.

The "Widget is disposed" exception is being handled and is shown in the log 
but it is not the reason for the workbench to not start.

Have to guess that the ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException was causing the problem.

Closing since the ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException is fixed. Please reopen if 
you see this problem again. Next time try "kill -3" so print the stack trace 
so we can check it.
